attributes.action: ensure that Northern irish and Scotish notes are accepted as legal tender
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The bank of England licences banks in Northern Irland and scotland to print sterling notes but then on their own website do not recognise it as legal tender, see quote at the bottom from the website. 

I believe that if the Bank of England has allowed the licence then it should be accepted by English banks and shops


Quote: 
Are Scottish & Northern Irish notes legal tender?
In short ‘No’ these notes are not legal tender; only Bank of England notes are legal tender but only in England and Wales.
